page.title: 11PASCHOE FARM NEAR BOW
page.content: Mrs.Blake met us and asked some questions about crops.She picked wheat and barley for us to paint later. Mr. Blake showed us around the barley beef fattening unit and we saw calves grouped according to size and age. There was an enormous bull called Harpoon Stardom. We went to see the Paschoe Oak which was mentioned in the Domesday Book and then we saw a large badgers' set. We drove over to the Dairy unit which has 150 cows and on the way we stopped to see a field of stubble turnips. Mrs. Blake said the cows were giving about 2,500 litres a day and they were milked at 6am and 3.30pm. All the new calves are registered; have their markings painted on special cards and are given their pedigree names.
